question: Which cells produce Interleukin 17A?
ideal_answer: Interleukin (IL)-17A is secreted from T helper type 17 (TH17) cells.

snippets.text: Several studies have shown an increased expression/release of Th17 related cytokine, IL-17A in ASD.
interleukin (IL)-17A, secreted from T helper type 17 (TH17) cells,
IL-17A, markedly produced by TH17 cells
IL-22 and IL-17A derive from both independent and overlapping lineages, defined as T helper (Th)22 and IL-22+ Th17 cells.
